intro: Moschosma, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by distinctive, triangular seed pods. Moschosma is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various soil types make it both a common weed and an important plant in ecological studies.
